The timeframe in which Trump shifted from optimism to threats of military action against Hamas, signaling a sharp escalation in rhetoric just days after the ceasefire agreement.

keyTakeAways: President Donald Trump threatened to authorize a military action against Hamas if the group continues killing civilians in Gaza, signaling a significant escalation in his rhetoric post-ceasefire deal.
Trump clarified that U.S. forces would not directly participate in any offensive, instead implying that nearby allies or regional actors would carry out such operations under U.S. authorization.

Hamas has reportedly used the ceasefire to reassert control in Gaza, targeting Palestinians accused of collaborating with Israeli forces, raising concerns about human rights and the stability of the peace agreement.
Trump previously dismissed early reports of Hamas executions, but now warns that if Hamas fails to adhere to its obligations, the war could resume immediately upon his word.
The threat comes amid growing tension over Hamas’s post-ceasefire actions, including alleged killings and public executions, undermining trust in the ceasefire and threatening the peace process.

Trump has indicated that Israel will return to active operations in Gaza if Hamas does not comply, and he expressed confidence that Hamas will honor its commitments, but warned of consequences if they do not.

summaryOfNewsArticle: President Donald Trump issued a stark warning that if Hamas continues killing civilians in Gaza, the United States will 'go in and kill them,' marking a sharp reversal from his earlier optimistic tone after a ceasefire agreement. Although he clarified that U.S. forces would not directly intervene, he authorized regional actors to take action under U.S. auspices. This threat comes amid reports that Hamas has used the ceasefire to target Palestinians accused of collaborating with Israeli forces, undermining confidence in the peace deal and prompting concerns about its stability. Trump reiterated that Israel could resume military operations if Hamas fails to comply, and he expressed confidence that Hamas would honor its commitments, warning that failure to do so would result in consequences.
title: Trump threatens to ‘go in and kill’ Hamas if group doesn’t stop killing in Gaza
